rationales.security: He rejects the better-paid night shift, sacrificing income stability.
rationales.benevolence: He prioritizes consistent tutoring support for specific children at the center.
rationales.universalism: He frames choices around helping vulnerable groups and funding clean water projects.

rationales.self_direction: He intentionally structures his work life to preserve autonomy for volunteering.
rationales.security: He favors flexible gig work over a more stable regular job.
rationales.universalism: He focuses on redirecting time and money toward refugees and broader social need.
He is emotionally affected by deadly labor injustice affecting distant others.

rationales.conformity: He stays to avoid being rude, prioritizing social expectations.
rationales.universalism: He evaluates personal spending against its opportunity cost for clean water aid.

rationales.self_direction: He asserts an independently chosen life path based on his own principles.
rationales.conformity: He resists family expectations about a conventional career trajectory.
rationales.universalism: He explicitly optimizes his life around minimizing harm and maximizing social good.
He endorses living with ongoing awareness of global suffering and focusing on a tractable part of it.
His anger centers on systemic inequality and underfunded programs for people in need.

rationales.security: He rejects prioritizing retirement and stability when it conflicts with immediate moral action.
rationales.conformity: He resists family and social norms that frame care as occasional charity.
rationales.universalism: He grounds his choices in privilege awareness and responsibility to people beyond his immediate circle.
